segment.source: Configure S/MIME for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure S/MIME for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile (Windows 10)

segment.source: In Windows 10, S/MIME lets users encrypt outgoing messages and attachments so that only intended recipients who have a digital identification (ID), also known as a certificate, can read them.
segment.target: In Windows 10, S/MIME lets users encrypt outgoing messages and attachments so that only intended recipients who have a digital identification (ID), also known as a certificate, can read them.

segment.source: Configure S/MIME for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Configure S/MIME for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: S/MIME stands for Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions, and provides an added layer of security for email sent to and from an Exchange ActiveSync (EAS) account.
segment.target: S/MIME stands for Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions, and provides an added layer of security for email sent to and from an Exchange ActiveSync (EAS) account.

segment.source: In Windows 10, S/MIME lets users encrypt outgoing messages and attachments so that only intended recipients who have a digital identification (ID), also known as a certificate, can read them.
segment.target: In Windows 10, S/MIME lets users encrypt outgoing messages and attachments so that only intended recipients who have a digital identification (ID), also known as a certificate, can read them.

segment.source: Users can digitally sign a message, which provides the recipients with a way to verify the identity of the sender and that the message hasn't been tampered with.
segment.target: Users can digitally sign a message, which provides the recipients with a way to verify the identity of the sender and that the message hasn't been tampered with.

segment.source: About message encryption
segment.target: About message encryption

segment.source: Users can send encrypted message to people in their organization and people outside their organization if they have their encryption certificates.
segment.target: Users can send encrypted message to people in their organization and people outside their organization if they have their encryption certificates.

segment.source: However, users using Windows 10 Mail app can only read encrypted messages if the message is received on their Exchange account and they have corresponding decryption keys.
segment.target: However, users using Windows 10 Mail app can only read encrypted messages if the message is received on their Exchange account and they have corresponding decryption keys.

segment.source: Encrypted messages can be read only by recipients who have a certificate.
segment.target: Encrypted messages can be read only by recipients who have a certificate.

segment.source: If you try to send an encrypted message to recipient(s) whose encryption certificate are not available, the app will prompt you to remove these recipients before sending the email.
segment.target: If you try to send an encrypted message to recipient(s) whose encryption certificate are not available, the app will prompt you to remove these recipients before sending the email.

segment.source: About digital signatures
segment.target: About digital signatures

segment.source: A digitally signed message reassures the recipient that the message hasn't been tampered with and verifies the identity of the sender.
segment.target: A digitally signed message reassures the recipient that the message hasn't been tampered with and verifies the identity of the sender.

segment.source: Recipients can only verify the digital signature if they’re using an email client that supports S/MIME.
segment.target: Recipients can only verify the digital signature if they’re using an email client that supports S/MIME.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: S/MIME is enabled for Exchange accounts (on-premises and Office 365).
segment.target: S/MIME is enabled for Exchange accounts (on-premises and Office 365).

segment.source: Users can’t use S/MIME signing and encryption with a personal account such as Outlook.com.
segment.target: Users can’t use S/MIME signing and encryption with a personal account such as Outlook.com.

segment.source: Valid Personal Information Exchange (PFX) certificates are installed on the device.
segment.target: Valid Personal Information Exchange (PFX) certificates are installed on the device.

segment.source: How to Create PFX Certificate Profiles in Configuration Manager
segment.target: How to Create PFX Certificate Profiles in Configuration Manager

segment.source: Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Install digital certificates on Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Install digital certificates on Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Choose S/MIME settings
segment.target: Choose S/MIME settings

segment.source: On the device, perform the following steps: (add select certificate)
segment.target: On the device, perform the following steps: (add select certificate)

segment.source: Open the Mail app.
segment.target: Open the Mail app.

segment.source: (In Windows 10 Mobile, the app is Outlook Mail.)
segment.target: (In Windows 10 Mobile, the app is Outlook Mail.)

segment.source: Open Settings by tapping the gear icon on a PC, or the ellipsis (...) and then the gear icon on a phone.
segment.target: Open Settings by tapping the gear icon on a PC, or the ellipsis (...) and then the gear icon on a phone.

segment.source: settings icon in mail app
segment.target: settings icon in mail app

segment.source: Tap Email security.
segment.target: Tap Email security.

segment.source: email security settings
segment.target: email security settings

segment.source: In Select an account, select the account for which you want to configure S/MIME options.
segment.target: In Select an account, select the account for which you want to configure S/MIME options.

segment.source: Make a certificate selection for digital signature and encryption.
segment.target: Make a certificate selection for digital signature and encryption.

segment.source: Select Automatically to let the app choose the certificate.
segment.target: Select Automatically to let the app choose the certificate.

segment.source: Select Manually to specify the certificate yourself from the list of valid certificates on the device.
segment.target: Select Manually to specify the certificate yourself from the list of valid certificates on the device.

segment.source: (Optional) Select Always sign with S/MIME, Always encrypt with S/MIME, or both, to automatically digitally sign or encrypt all outgoing messages.
segment.target: (Optional) Select Always sign with S/MIME, Always encrypt with S/MIME, or both, to automatically digitally sign or encrypt all outgoing messages.

segment.source: Note: The option to sign or encrypt can be changed for individual messages, unless EAS policies prevent it.
segment.target: Note: The option to sign or encrypt can be changed for individual messages, unless EAS policies prevent it.

segment.source: Tap the back arrow.
segment.target: Tap the back arrow.

segment.source: Encrypt or sign individual messages
segment.target: Encrypt or sign individual messages

segment.source: While composing a message, choose Options from the ribbon.
segment.target: While composing a message, choose Options from the ribbon.

segment.source: On phone, Options can be accessed by tapping the the ellipsis (...).
segment.target: On phone, Options can be accessed by tapping the the ellipsis (...).

segment.source: Use Sign and Encrypt icons to turn on digital signature and encryption for this message.
segment.target: Use Sign and Encrypt icons to turn on digital signature and encryption for this message.

segment.source: sign or encrypt message
segment.target: sign or encrypt message

segment.source: Read signed or encrypted messages
segment.target: Read signed or encrypted messages

segment.source: When you receive an encrypted message, the mail app will check whether there is a certificate available on your computer.
segment.target: When you receive an encrypted message, the mail app will check whether there is a certificate available on your computer.

segment.source: If there is a certificate available, the message will be decrypted when you open it.
segment.target: If there is a certificate available, the message will be decrypted when you open it.

segment.source: If your certificate is stored on a smartcard, you will be prompted to insert the smartcard to read the message.
segment.target: If your certificate is stored on a smartcard, you will be prompted to insert the smartcard to read the message.

segment.source: Your smartcard may also require a PIN to access the certificate.
segment.target: Your smartcard may also require a PIN to access the certificate.

segment.source: Install certificates from a received message
segment.target: Install certificates from a received message

segment.source: When you receive a signed email, the app provide feature to install corresponding encryption certificate on your device if the certificate is available.
segment.target: When you receive a signed email, the app provide feature to install corresponding encryption certificate on your device if the certificate is available.

segment.source: This certificate can then be used to send encrypted email to this person.
segment.target: This certificate can then be used to send encrypted email to this person.

segment.source: Open a signed email.
segment.target: Open a signed email.

segment.source: Tap or click the digital signature icon in the reading pane.
segment.target: Tap or click the digital signature icon in the reading pane.

segment.source: Tap Install.
segment.target: Tap Install.

segment.source: message security information
segment.target: message security information
